titleStmt.title: Charles Gahres and Martha J. Gahres v. Isabella Sutton and W. H. Barrett. Plaintiffs Appealing Former Action

publicationStmt.authority: Bring Me the Body: A Digital & Print History of Marginalized Habeas Corpus Petitioners in the North American West, 1804-1912

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Charles Gahres and Martha J. Gahres v. Isabella Sutton and W. H. Barrett. Plaintiffs Appealing Former Action
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District court of the first Judicial District
Charles Gahres and Martha J. Gahres Plffs
W.H. Barret and Isabella Sutton Deft

Whereas the Defendants in the above Entitled action has appealed to the Supreme Court of the Territory of Washington from an order entered against them in said District court on the 12th day of July 1871 awarding the custody of a minor child of Plantiff named Ella Dora Cravens to Defts and also from a judgement entered at some time to wit July 12th 1871 by said District Court in said action for sum of Sixty five dollars as cost of said suit and every part thereof of said order and judgement Now therefore in consideration of the presence and of such
appeal we the undersigned Charles R Gahres of Broken City Oregon as principal and Wm Kahlhauff of the City and country of Walla Walla Territory of Washington or on behalf of the appellants do hereby jointly and severally undertake and promise that the said appellant will pay all damages and costs which may be awarded against them on the appeal not exceeding one hundred and thirty dollars to which amount we ackowledge ourselves jointly and severally bound In whereof we have hereinto and seal this 13th day of July 1871
